etymologies: mid 18th century: from French, earlier vau de ville (or vire), said to be a name given originally to songs composed by Olivier Basselin, a 15th-century fuller born in Vau de Vire in Normandy

definitions: a type of entertainment popular chiefly in the US in the early 20th century, featuring a mixture of specialty acts such as burlesque comedy and song and dance

examples.text: his comedic roots are in vaudeville
a stage show with vaudeville acts and dancing girls

shortDefinitions: type of entertainment popular chiefly in US in early 20th century

definitions: a stage play on a trivial theme with interspersed songs.
shortDefinitions: light or comic stage play with interspersed songs

definitions: a satirical or topical song with a refrain.
shortDefinitions: satirical or topical song with refrain
